result.execSummary:
The defendant Gustav F Schlitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 3 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Schlitz, Gustav F

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court.   Defendant Gustav F Schlitz did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend charge number 1.  Attorney Redetzke enters a no contest plea to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements.  Court orders the following:  FORFEITURE:  $395.00 to be paid within 90 days.  Failure to pay will result in 3 days jail.  If there is bail money remaining, bail to be applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gustavo F Schlitz in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant needs additional time for completion of his treatment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gustavo F Schlitz in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Redetzke advises his clients name is spelled GUSTAV.  Court to make the change on CCAP.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
February 10, 2016 Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel from Atty Kirk Redetzke

Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court.   Defendant Gustavo F Schlitz did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves for a capias.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements.  Court issues capias, cashbail in the amount of $200.00.  Court revokes/forfeits bail.  Defendant showed up lated.  Case recalled at 10:16 am. Court vacates the prior order to forfeit bail and quashes capias. Court schedules a new hearing.  Court tried to contact Attorney Redetzke, got voice mail.
dated January 20, 2016 Request for adjournment filed by defendant
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.

Defendant Gustavo F Schlitz in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's current correct name is Gustav F. Schlitz,   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
